original_solution_mapping.L1: Michael takes half which is 60 pieces / 2 = <<60/2=30>>30 pieces.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Paige then takes half of this which gives her 30 pieces / 2 = <<30/2=15>>15 pieces.
original_solution_mapping.L3: Mandy is therefore left with 60 pieces - 30 pieces - 15 pieces = <<60-30-15=15>>15 pieces.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 7265.
    Returns: the number of chocolate pieces Mandy will get.
    """
    # L1
    total_pieces = 60 # 60 pieces
    michael_share_divisor = 2 # half of the bar
    michael_pieces = total_pieces / michael_share_divisor

    # L2
    paige_share_divisor = 2 # half of the remainder
    paige_pieces = michael_pieces / paige_share_divisor

    # L3
    mandy_pieces = total_pieces - michael_pieces - paige_pieces

    # FA
    answer = mandy_pieces
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Michael takes half which is {total_pieces} pieces / {michael_share_divisor} = <<{total_pieces}/{michael_share_divisor}={michael_pieces}>>{michael_pieces} pieces.
Paige then takes half of this which gives her {michael_pieces} pieces / {paige_share_divisor} = <<{michael_pieces}/{paige_share_divisor}={paige_pieces}>>{paige_pieces} pieces.
Mandy is therefore left with {total_pieces} pieces - {michael_pieces} pieces - {paige_pieces} pieces = <<{total_pieces}-{michael_pieces}-{paige_pieces}={mandy_pieces}>>{mandy_pieces} pieces.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Michael takes half which is 60 pieces / 2 = <<60/2=30>>30 pieces.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Paige then takes half of this which gives her 30 pieces / 30 = <<30/30=1>>1 pieces.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: Mandy is therefore left with 60 pieces - 30 pieces - 1 pieces = <<60-30-1=29>>29 pieces.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'michael_pieces' (30.0) was used instead of 'paige_share_divisor' (2).
